meanings.definition: To integrate or include (someone or something) in the dominant culture or society.
meanings.sent1: The school mainstreamed students with disabilities into regular classes.
meanings.sent2: The new song was mainstreamed and became a hit on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The alien was mainstreamed into human society, causing quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her unique fashion sense was mainstreamed, turning heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The idea of recycling was mainstreamed to protect the environment.

meanings.definition: To bring (something) into the mainstream or popular culture.
meanings.sent1: The company mainstreamed their product by advertising on social media.
meanings.sent2: The TV show was mainstreamed and gained a large following.
meanings.sent3: The talking cat was mainstreamed in the movie, adding a fun twist.
meanings.sent4: His artwork was mainstreamed, becoming a symbol of the modern art movement.
meanings.sent5: The dance move was mainstreamed and soon everyone was doing it.
